meanings.definition: to travel from place to place
meanings.sent1: She will itinerate across the country to visit all the national parks.
meanings.sent2: The circus performers itinerate to different cities every week.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous cat decided to itinerate through the neighborhood, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts itinerate like a restless wanderer, never staying in one place for long.
meanings.sent5: The idea of freedom made her heart itinerate with excitement.

meanings.sent1: The itinerate musician entertained the crowd with songs from various cultures.
meanings.sent2: Their itinerate lifestyle allowed them to experience different cultures firsthand.
meanings.sent3: The itinerate penguin waddled around the zoo, exploring every exhibit.
meanings.sent4: Her itinerate mind was always seeking new experiences and adventures.
meanings.sent5: The itinerate clouds drifted lazily across the sky, never staying in one place for too long.

meanings.definition: a person who travels from place to place
meanings.sent1: The explorer was known as an itinerate, always seeking new lands to discover.
meanings.sent2: The itinerate shared stories of their adventures with eager listeners.
meanings.sent3: The itinerate was welcomed warmly in every town they visited, sharing tales of distant lands.
meanings.sent4: The itinerate's backpack was filled with mementos from their travels around the world.
meanings.sent5: The itinerate's journal was a colorful record of their journeys, filled with sketches and notes.
